item.title: CoD: Warzone Patch Notes Detail Bug Fixes And Changes To Deadline LTM
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

A new update arrived to Call of Duty: Warzone on September 16. While this is a very small update, the patch notes include a few notable bug fixes and changes to Season 5's Deadline limited-time mode.

Season 5 Reloaded added the new Deadline limited-time mode, and now the new update makes a few improvements to the match rules. Circles two, three, and four are now extended by 30 seconds each. The developer says this change was made to allow players "extra time to coordinate and rack up points," while also slowing down the gas to provide players with more breathing room.

Want us to remember this setting for all your devices?

Sign up or Sign in now!

Please use a html5 video capable browser to watch videos.

This video has an invalid file format.

Sorry, but you can't access this content!

Now Playing: Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 - Ashes of the Damned Zombies Cinematic Trailer

Deadline's respawn timers are reduced by five seconds, which lets players jump back into the action faster. Additionally, the mode's "Round End" warning will now show 60 seconds from the end instead of the original 30-second warning.

As for bug fixes, the patch notes reveal the update corrected an issue that previously prevented players from accessing their custom parachutes and contrails. It also fixed an exploit where players could infinitely use Self-Revives.

Previously, the .410 Gauge Ball ammunition was dealing more damage than intended when equipped with the Riveter shotgun, but the developer says this has been corrected with the new update.

The full patch notes can be seen below, as shared by Activision.

Season 5 Reloaded was a small update for Warzone, and we don't have any details yet for the next season. We likely won't receive any new details on the future of Warzone until Activision's annual Activision's Call of Duty: Next event on September 30. Call of Duty: Next will include live gameplay and other new announcements for Black Ops 7 multiplayer, Zombies, and Warzone.

The new Black Ops 7's Zombies trailer confirmed the new and old cast of characters will be fighting alongside each other in Dark Aether, as they work to defeat a new threat and regain their souls.

Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 launches on November 14 for PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X|S, Xbox One, and PC. The Black Ops 7 multiplayer beta early access begins on October 2 for Xbox, PlayStation, and PC platforms.

WARZONE PATCH NOTES

Modes

Deadline Limited-Time Mode

  • Extended circles 2, 3, and 4 by 30 seconds.
    • This gives players extra time to coordinate and rack up points, while slowing down the gas to provide a bit more breathing room.
  • Reduced respawn timers by 5 seconds, letting players jump back into the action faster.
  • The "Round Ends" widget will now show 60 seconds from the end instead of 30.

Bug fixes

  • Fixed an issue preventing players from accessing custom Parachutes and Contrails.
  • Fixed an issue where the .410 Gauge Ball ammunition was dealing more damage than intended when used with the Riveter.
  • Fixed an exploit allowing players to infinitely use Self-Revives.
  • Fixed an issue where the "Redeploy All" button at the Buy Station would prioritize a disconnected teammate. It will now correctly prioritize connected teammates.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com



https://www.gamespot.com/articles/cod-warzone-patch-notes-detail-bug-fixes-and-changes-to-deadline-ltm/1100-6534785/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

item.title: A Heist Just Went Down At Disney World That Sounds Like Something Out Of A Movie
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Disney World is one of the most popular tourist attractions in the United States, and there have been a number of high-profile incidents at the park over the years, the newest of which was a daring, underwater heist--and the suspect remains on the loose.

Florida authorities said this week that a man stole as much as $20,000 at Paddlefish, a popular restaurant located on Disney property at nearby Disney Springs. Cops say the robber swam up to Paddlefish just after midnight on Monday, September 15--when it was closed--and entered the manager's office.

Money was being counted at the time, authorities said, and the suspect instructed two staffers to close their eyes and stand in the corner. A source told WFTV 9 that the suspect tied them up, and then stole between $10,000 and $20,000. The employees informed police that the burgular left within 120 seconds, and that they called 911 after getting free of their bonds.

The Paddlefish is a restaurant and bar located on a replica steamboat that sits in a lake. Authorities said the suspect got back into the water and swam away in scuba gear--police searched the area and found nothing. As of September 17, the suspect apparently remains at large.

Beyond all of this, the suspect was said to have used spray paint to cover a security camera during the daring heist.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com



https://www.gamespot.com/articles/a-heist-just-went-down-at-disney-world-that-sounds-like-something-out-of-a-movie/1100-6534779/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

item.title: Escape From Tarkov On Steam Will Require You Buy It Again
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Escape From Tarkov, the first-person shooter that popularized the extraction genre, is finally coming to Steam, albeit with a catch. Those who already own the game will have to buy it again if they want to launch it through Steam.

In a Steam FAQ that went live alongside the Escape From Tarkov Steam page, developer Battlestate Games explained more details about how the game will work on Steam, what Steam functionality it will support, and whether or not players who already own the game will be able to launch it through Steam.

The short answer is that those who already bought Escape From Tarkov, which until now has only been available directly from Battlestate Games' own launcher or website, won't be able to start using the Steam version. Instead, existing owners who want to play on Steam will need to purchase an edition of the game on Steam itself.

After buying Escape from Tarkov on Steam, players who already own the game can link their Battlestate Games account to then get access to whatever edition of the game they previously purchased, their profile, and their character data. All players, regardless of whether they are an existing owner or buying Escape From Tarkov for the first time on Steam, will be required to have a Battlestate account in order to play.

It's disappointing news for existing owners. Some had hoped they would simply be able to link their Steam and Battlestate accounts in order to gain access to the Steam version, something other developers that allowed players to buy their games directly from a website, like Dark and Darker and Path of Exile 2, have done in the past.

Instead, Battlestate Games is charging for the privilege of launching Escape From Tarkov on Steam. How much Escape From Tarkov will cost on Steam is currently unknown, but the game's standard edition currently sells for $50 on the game's official website. Considering there are editions of Escape From Tarkov that sell for $100 or (controversially) $250, Battlestate Games trying to resell the Steam version to existing owners isn't going over well with the game's community.

Battlestate additionally revealed in the FAQ that Escape From Tarkov will support Steam achievements and Steam friends but won't work on Steam Deck. It also won't support Steam Workshop or Steam Family Sharing.

Escape From Tarkov is slated to arrive on Steam November 15, when it will officially leave beta after eight years and release its 1.0 update. The game currently unavailable for preorder on Steam, but those interested can currently wishlist it. A pre-download for Escape From Tarkov prior to launch is not planned.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com



https://www.gamespot.com/articles/escape-from-tarkov-on-steam-will-require-you-buy-it-again/1100-6534783/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

item.title: CoD: Black Ops 7 Zombies Trailer Shows Iconic Characters Fighting For Their Souls
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 arrives November 14, and Treyarch is bringing a continuation of its Zombies storyline. A full cinematic trailer has now arrived to show the Black Ops 6 crew fighting alongside Treyarch's iconic cast of original Zombies characters.

As shown in the Ashes of the Damned trailer, Black Ops 7's Zombies mode picks up right where Black Ops 6's storyline ended with the Reckoning's main Easter egg quest. Weaver and his crew are standing alongside Takeo, Dempsey, Nikolai, and Richtofen inside of Janus Towers. However, the building and everyone inside has been thrust into the Dark Aether dimension.

Want us to remember this setting for all your devices?

Sign up or Sign in now!

Please use a html5 video capable browser to watch videos.

This video has an invalid file format.

Sorry, but you can't access this content!

Now Playing: Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 - Ashes of the Damned Zombies Cinematic Trailer

There is still plenty of uncertainty on how the original cast ended up in Janus Towers with Weaver's team, but the trailer shows the two separate casts fighting together as they face the undead and some mysterious new villain. This new threat is a man with a southern drawl and a cowboy hat, who lugs around caged-up zombie heads.

The man uses his zombie heads to seemingly use magic to pull the life force from both teams, leaving all the characters looking purple-eyed and partially zombified. So, it seems the Black Ops 7 storyline will be based around fighting this new enemy, gaining back their souls, and escaping the Dark Aether.

Black Ops 7 launches with the largest round-based map the mode has ever seen, and as can be expected from the trailer, the map takes place inside the Dark Aether. The map is inspired by Black Ops 2's Tranzit map, and a new Wonder Vehicle will be used to traverse the dangerous roads that connect different areas of the map. Activision also appears to be creating a real-life version of this new Zombies vehicle, as spotted during an online stream.

It's also worth noting that Treyarch has confirmed the iconic characters in Black Ops 7 are not the same variants of the cast we've seen in previous years. Instead of the Ultimis or Primis versions of the characters, they are "never-before-seen incarnations" of the original Zombies crew.

The developer said more Zombies information would be revealed next week. Additional Black Ops 7 details and live gameplay will arrive during the Call of Duty: Next event on September 30. The Black Ops 7 multiplayer beta early access begins on October 2 for Xbox, PlayStation, and PC platforms.

Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 launches on November 14 for PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X|S, Xbox One, and PC. You can find highlights of all major Black Ops 7 announcements here, which includes details on the campaign, a massive round-based Zombies map, and a futuristic multiplayer.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com



https://www.gamespot.com/articles/cod-black-ops-7-zombies-trailer-shows-iconic-characters-fighting-for-their-souls/1100-6534778/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

item.title: First New Skate Game In 15 Years Is Out Now, And It's Free
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

EA's skateboarding series, Skate, has been dormant since 2010's Skate 3, but it's officially back today with the launch of a reboot that's simply titled Skate. You don't have to pay a penny to get it, as it's a free game available for everyone on PC, PS5, and Xbox Series X|S.

The version of the game launching today is an unfinished, early-access edition of the game. As such, players may encounter bugs or other oddities. Additionally, developer Full Circle plans to add new game modes, tricks, leaderboards, party voice chat, and other improvements over time.

The original Skate games were paid releases, but the new Skate is a free-to-play, always-online game, with EA making money off the game through the sale of microtransactions.

The original Skate came out in 2007, with sequels Skate 2 and Skate 3 arriving in 2009 and 2010, respectively. A mobile game, Skate It, launched in 2008. The franchise went dormant for more than a decade before EA announce a new Skate, simply called Skate, in 2020.

The game takes place in the fictional world of San Vansterdamn, which itself is made up of four unique neighborhoods. Full Circle said the world is "ever-evolving" and that players can expert new areas, challenges, and music to be added throughout early access.

While the Skate series has been gone for some time before it came back today, Activision's Tony Hawk series has seen multiple successful releases, including Pro Skater 1+2 and then 3+4 more recently. Outside of Tony Hawk and Skate, the play-as-a-bird skateboarding game SkateBird came out in 2021, followed by the skater sim Session in 2022.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com



https://www.gamespot.com/articles/first-new-skate-game-in-15-years-is-out-now-and-its-free/1100-6534774/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f
